text: I'd rather call it Rambo lame bloodfeast. Slow at the beginning, nonsensical in the middle, splatter in the last 30 minutes, gives nothing more to the saga. Why, Sly, tell me why!

I am a fan of Sly’s work and art to the silver screen. Having watched all the Rambo’s each movie tells a story with the mix of action and violence.

In the latest Rambo after watching it again for the second time in full, I admire the real graphic violent which Sly brings to elite. It’s grittier, emotional and aftermath. No other true Hollywood legend does it better without the use of flake CGI or Green Screen effects.

Rambo should be around today to fight and clear our today’s global mess.
Um dos melhores filmes de todos os tempos; filme espetacular e o Stallone é o melhor!!!
i mean it’s what you want to see in a rambo movie after it evolved into a bloody massacre of bad guys at the hand of one person. a good revenge story of someone with nothing left to lose
Perfect end to the Rambo franchise. Brings a whole new meaning to the phrase “Fuck around and find out”
Overall worth a watch however it doesn’t live up to the series standards and is an unfortunate send off for such a great series
De esta mejor no hablar mucho diciendo solo que Rambo IV era mucho mejor final que esta
Every time someone speaks it hurts.

Il film, non è Rambo. È un ottimo film d'azione, mantiene l'idea degli ultimi 3 film che Rambo aiuti i buoni, ma non è semplicemente un film adatto a questa saga. Le scene d'azione sono fantastiche, ma hanno scomodato l'anziano Stallone per guadagnare ancora qualcosa.

With two guardians that have knowledge of the danger south of the border and in the hearts of men, the girl chooses an action that is overwhelming illogical if they raised her. You must disregard all logic to accept the premise of this screenplay because it doesn't make any sense. If you can do that it is a decent action movie. I can't do it...
I think America needs a Rambo right now. Loved this movie and I watched it at just the right time
Una obra de arte, historia compleja y fuerte pero muy buena la verdad..

Last Blood is a great ending to an absolutely fantastic franchise (we can ignore Rambo 3). While not Quite having Stallone's directoral spark it's honestly still a good film with some absolutely hardcore and even hard to watch brutal scenes. It's definitely the most violent Rambo installment and has some really great special effects. I think Stallone's Rambo franchise slightly beats The Terminator Franchise because the last two films (from The Terminator Franchise) are absolutely terrible, Rambo films are going to be amazing for a midweek film slump where I need a short action film. In a way it almost feels like a Western but honestly for what it is it's very good as it's own thing (hard to explain).

Rambo (2008) - A Forgettable, Bloody Skirmish*

Sylvester Stallone reprises his iconic role as John Rambo in this lackluster installment. The film's setting shifts to the Thai-Burma border, where Rambo (Stallone) gets entangled in a mission to rescue a group of Christian aid workers from the brutal Burmese army.

The plot is predictable and formulaic, with Rambo single-handedly taking down hordes of enemies in a series of grueling battles. While Stallone still brings some charisma to the role, his character's development is stagnant, and his motivations feel contrived.

The film's pacing is uneven, veering wildly between moments of intense action and awkward dialogue. The supporting cast, including Ken Choi and Reed Diamond, is underutilized and forgettable.

The film's themes of violence, redemption, and the cyclical nature of conflict are timely, but they're handled heavy-handedly. The cinematography is competent, but it lacks the flair and style that would elevate the film beyond its mediocrity.

Overall, *Rambo (2008)* feels like a rehashing of familiar tropes without adding anything new or compelling to the franchise. It's a bloody, forgettable skirmish that fails to leave a lasting impact.

If you're a die-hard Rambo fan, you might find some enjoyment in this film. Otherwise, it's skippable.
My favorite movie of all time.
Epically horrible film.  Screenplay is a disaster and the whole premise is contrived garbage.  No excuses here.  This is possibly one of the worst films ever made.  Do not waste your time.
